column5: I went with my girlfriend this morning up to Simcoe most fisherman went to popular spots that were mentioned on lots of Boards. We went somewhere different and got lucky with lots of perch over 7 inches. We both kept our limits of Jumbos between 7 and 8 inches We now have 100 perch each to clean. .
Wow sounds like you folks got your work cut out for ya...Guess you'll have enough perch in the freezer to last ya out the winter now......Any pics from your outing today ???  Enjoy !!!!

I went with my girlfriend this morning up to Simcoe most fisherman went to popular spots that were mentioned on lots of Boards. We went somewhere different and got lucky with lots of perch over 7 inches. We both kept our limits of Jumbos between 7 and 8 inches We now have 100 perch each to clean. .          The limit is 100 perch per person on lake simcoe?
What..a report with no pretty pictures so we can put a face to the name... and I presume you mean you have a 100 fish to clean between you..not each?  No problem finding bait ?
i kept 20 between 2 people today (over 9 inches today) and  that was More than enough Cleaning for one afternoon
I thought it was fifty per person.

thats wut im sayin. obviously hes new to fishing if he thinks anything over 7" is a jumbo. imho anything over 11 or 12 inches is a jumbo. lets just hope buddy didnt actually keep 100 perch each   teach him bout the regs guys
So did i clampet.    I was thinking the same thing when he called 6-7 inches Jumbo's....lol...I am guessing this is his 1st post and as you said pretty new to fishing so thought i had best be gentle.
50 Per Person with regular licence, 25 with conservation licence
gentle....what for? lol  mayube they spent the night there and caught 50 each over 2 days?
Well better to be gentle than mean aint it?
No reason to be gentle Ignorance is no excuse!
I say we let him clarify himself before we place the dagger in his back and start twisting.  Gerritt.
Well actually a Jumbo is over 12", and if they were just 7-8" long... they were prolly stunted and needed a good "cleaning out". So you did good Cala!!!
I can't imagine cleaning 100 fish ... take me dang near the entire afternoon, but I'll bet they're mighty tasty.    Sounds like a load of fun though.
I think this 42 year old squid needs to tell us some more details lol
thats why theres electric filleting knives
